metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2126 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Out-of-bounds Read in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2126` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.2
vim-athena - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.2
vim-common - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.2
vim-gtk3 - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.2
vim-gui-common - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.2
vim-motif - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.2
vim-nox - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.2
vim-runtime - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.2
vim-tiny - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.2
xxd - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> in bionic and earlier the vulnerable code is in src/spell.c instead of src/spellsuggest.c.

criterions.comment: vim package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.2').
